author: rbb
msg: On FreeBSD, it is possible for the first call to sendfile to
get EAGAIN, but still send some data.  This means that we cannot
call sendfile and then check for EAGAIN, and then wait and call
sendfile again.  If we do that, then we are likely to send the
first chunk of data twice, once in the first call and once in the
second.  If we are using a timed write, then we check to make sure
we can send data before trying to send it.  This gets sendfile working

author: rbb
msg: Cleanups so that the support programs build cleanly.  The Win32 values

author: brane
msg: Don't export symbols from static library.

author: wrowe
msg: Allow any support stuff we've authored to rely soley on apr (+aprutil)

author: rbb
msg: The sendfile test needs to treat TIMEOUT clients as if they were
NON-blocking.  There is no reason to think that a TIMEOUT client will
be able to send everything in one pass.
